item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

It’s almost winter, so don’t feel bad about bulking up—your pantry and your reading list! We’ll help you get ready for the holidays (or hibernation) with these perfect books-and-bites pairings.

From seasonal stories and treats to share with others to international romances with dinner to match, these duos will complement any reader’s palate all winter long. Happy reading—and bon appétit!

The Book: American Love Story (Dreamers) by Adriana Herrera

The Bite: Curried Roasted Butternut Squash Soup

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

In American Love Story, a Haitian-born professor teams up with an all-American lawyer for a social justice cause that brings them together both consciously and physically.

This romantic pairing inspires brings to mind a fall favorite that incorporates elements of a traditional Haitian pumpkin soup and an autumnal American classic.

The Book: A Down-Home Savannah Christmas (The Savannah Sisters) by Nancy Robards Thompson

The Bite: Pecan Pie Bars

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

It’s Christmas in Savannah, where stranger things than a snowfall have happened—like Elle falling for the man she considers her nemesis, regardless of how good his intentions are.

This Christmas, eat like you’re spending the holidays in Savannah with this take on a Southern staple. It’s perfect for a holiday buffet or as a snack alongside a cup of tea and a great romance.

The Book: Holiday by Candlelight (Sutter Creek, Montana) by Laurel Greer

The Bite: Potato Latkes

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

For a doctor and a search-and-rescue worker each nurturing a painful past, the holidays can be complicated. So is the attraction they can’t deny. But as the candles burn down, so do their barriers. 

Hanukkah is a festival commemorating the rededication of the holy temple in Jerusalem and the miracle of the oil in the lamps lasting eight days longer than anyone expected. To celebrate these events, Jewish people around the world cook foods in oil, and one of the most popular (and delicious) is the potato pancake known as a latke

The Book: Kisses in the Snow by Debbie Macomber

The Bite: Slow Cooker Peppermint Hot Chocolate

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

Escape from the winter chill with this heartwarming collection of two previously published holiday favorites from Debbie Macomber. Pair it with a treat featuring two other favorites that go together perfectly for a warm winter experience.

This delicious peppermint hot chocolate is easy to prepare in the slow cooker and makes the ideal accompaniment to a snowy afternoon spent curled up with a great book.

Which of these books-and-bites pairings will you dig into first? Let us know!

item.dc:creator: Elissa

item.description: The holiday season is almost here, and with that comes the perfect season for romance. If you want to watch your Christmas romances as well as read about them, we have three upcoming movies that will have you getting ready for kisses under the mistletoe. Christmas With a Prince: Becoming Royal After the Royal Christmas […]
item.content:encoded:
The holiday season is almost here, and with that comes the perfect season for romance. If you want to watch your Christmas romances as well as read about them, we have three upcoming movies that will have you getting ready for kisses under the mistletoe.

Christmas With a Prince: Becoming Royal

After the Royal Christmas dinner, Dr. Tasha and Prince Alexander jet off to St. Savarre to spend their Christmas holiday. He takes her on a tour of the beautifully snow blanketed country. Spending this time together, the love between Alexander and Tasha grows and he asks for her hand in marriage to which she happily says yes. Tasha is called away on an emergency, leaving Alexander to plan the wedding. Princess Miranda hears of this and starts to stir up some trouble.

Will Miranda succeed at breaking them up or will Tasha have her happily ever after?

The sequel to Christmas with A Prince, which was based on St. Piran’s: Prince on the Children’s Ward by Sarah Morgan

Where to watch:

November 3rd at 7 p.m. on UPtv

Christmas in Paris

Montana landscaper Robin Harbin is a modest woman — the closest she gets to glamour is gardening at the Fortune family’s local mansion. That’s where she meets her polar opposite, confirmed bachelor Amersen Baudin: rich, handsome, cultured, and with an ego the size of the south of France. She puts him through his paces, but they soon discover they’ve got more in common than quick wits and sarcasm — they’ve both lost someone recently, and are struggling to cope in their own ways. This leads to tension, but with a bit of help from their families and the magic of Christmas in the City of Lights, they are reminded that “la grand amour” might be closer to home than they thought.

Based on A Fortunes of Texas Christmas by Helen Lacey

Where to watch:

December 8th at 7pm EST on UPtv

Baby in a Manger

Child protective services officer Alison and police officer Brock are both sworn to protect children, so when a lost infant shows up in the local church’s nativity scene, they’re both on the case. The pair don’t exactly gel right away — they’re both take-charge personalities and neither of them wants to let anything get in the way of the baby’s safe return home. This leads to tension between the two officers, but also internal tension. Alison will stop at nothing to keep the baby safe, but we learn she’s having doubts about whether she’s ready for kids of her own. Brock is also passionate about the case, but seems to be holding onto a secret from his past. Between butting heads, and with a little advice from a helpful minister, the pair learn plenty about each other, themselves, family, and the complicated bond between parent and child. Can a miracle baby from a broken home bring this community together?

Based on “Child in a Manger” from A Family for Christmas by Irene Brand and Dana Corbit

Where to watch:

December 24th at 7 pm EST on UPtv

item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.category: Home on the Ranch: The Colorado Cowboy's Triplets
item.description: October 27 is Navy Day, dedicated to the celebration of those of who have served in the navy, and we are taking the opportunity to highlight some of our new navy heroes! No matter what romance genre you’re looking for, there’s a navy character below waiting for you. The Scrooge of Loon Lake by Carrie […]
item.content:encoded:
October 27 is Navy Day, dedicated to the celebration of those of who have served in the navy, and we are taking the opportunity to highlight some of our new navy heroes! No matter what romance genre you’re looking for, there’s a navy character below waiting for you.

The Scrooge of Loon Lake by Carrie Nichols

We’re starting off with a hero who definitely isn’t looking forward to the holiday season. Discharged from the navy, former lieutenant Des Gallagher isn’t exactly in a celebratory mood. Fortunately for him, Natalie Pierce is full of holiday cheer. Pick this one up if you can already feel yourself turning into a bit of a Scrooge and need a feel good pick me up to turn your mood around!

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Carrie Nichols

Home on the Ranch: The Colorado Cowboy’s Triplets by Laura Marie Altom

Navy SEAL Jed Monroe is confident that he can handle anything life has to throw at him…that is, until his three nieces are suddenly in his care and he finds himself turning to Camille Hall for help. If you’re looking for a second chance romance with two relatable characters, make sure this book is next on your TBR list.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Laura Marie Altom

Keeping Her Close by Carol Ross

Do you want both a protective hero and a heroine who can stand up for herself? This new read from Carol Ross is the best of both worlds, as former navy SEAL turned bodyguard Kyle Frasier is teaching Harper Jansen how to stay safe—though she certainly doesn’t need it. Now if only he could resist his feelings for her…

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Carol Ross

Tall, Dark and Devastating by Suzanne Brockmann

Get ready to enjoy two stories in one! Whether you’re in the mood for Senior Chief “Harvard” Becker, who believes P.J. is a very attractive distraction, or Navy SEAL Crash Hawken who wakes up to find himself wrongly accused of treason, with only Nell Burns believing his innocence, either story is a definite must-read from New York Times bestselling author Suzanne Brockmann.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Suzanne Brockmann

Dangerous Relations by Carol J. Post

Who doesn’t love to read about the forming of a family? Ryan McConnell knows he must protect Shelby Adair and their niece, especially when someone tries to kidnap the baby. Too bad Shelby isn’t sure if Ryan can be trusted. As the two work together to survive, they grow closer and become the family both of them are looking for.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Carol J. Post

Will you be picking up any of these great books? Let us know in the comments section below!

item.title: 4 New Western Romance Novels For Every Cowboy Fan
item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.description: by Karen Green This season may be all about falling leaves and pumpkin spice, but turn your head to the west and there’s a different feeling in the air: romance. Western romance is a natural fit for autumn weather, as our burly cowboys and boardroom barons pull their Stetsons just a little farther down over […]
item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

This season may be all about falling leaves and pumpkin spice, but turn your head to the west and there’s a different feeling in the air: romance.

Western romance is a natural fit for autumn weather, as our burly cowboys and boardroom barons pull their Stetsons just a little farther down over their ears and get to the business of working on—or getting rich off—the rugged landscape.

Take a look at these new Western romances that are perfect for fall—you might even want to draw inspiration from our outdoorsy heroes and heroines and find a cozy spot in the autumn sunshine to enjoy them. Pumpkin spice latte, optional.

Wyoming Heart (Wyoming Men) by Diana Palmer

The snow comes early to the mountains of Wyoming, so bundle up for this contemporary Western romance featuring a handsome—and handsomely wealthy—rancher whose roots are firmly planted on his land and the city girl who moves in next door and, despite their differences, plants herself firmly in his heart.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Diana Palmer

Rancher’s Wild Secret (Gold Valley Vineyards) by Maisey Yates

Ranching is often a family tradition that goes back generations, so it just makes sense that those involved in a ranching legacy make their share of friends—and enemies—along the way. Look to this sizzling romance featuring a rancher and the daughter of his family’s sworn nemesis to keep things hot as the weather starts to cool.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Maisey Yates

Lucky Break (Clean Slate Ranch) by A.M. Arthur

This LGBTQ story pairs a down-on-his-luck former rodeo star with a chef who has his own painful past. The men who work on this tourist ranch are a tough bunch—will they open up to the possibility of love?

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from A.M. Arthur

His Unexpected Return (Red Dog Ranch) by Jessica Keller

It’s hard not to find inspiration in the beautiful autumn season, so this tale of return, redemption, family and forgiveness on the Red Dog Ranch is the perfect read for fans of wholesome and family-centric Western romance.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Jessica Keller

Are you a fan of Western romances and cowboy heroes? Share your recommendations with fellow romance readers in the comments below!

item.title: How to Find A New Romance Miniseries For A New Season
item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.description: by Karen Green There’s nothing better for a reader than discovering a brand new series to love and look forward to, especially when it coincides with the changing of the seasons and the promise of exciting occasions and experiences ahead. These five new series’ and the debut novels celebrating each one feel like the perfect […]
item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

There’s nothing better for a reader than discovering a brand new series to love and look forward to, especially when it coincides with the changing of the seasons and the promise of exciting occasions and experiences ahead.

These five new series’ and the debut novels celebrating each one feel like the perfect little gift to usher in the advent of sweater weather and pumpkin spice everything.

Pick one up today; you deserve something new.

Wild River

The people that live in Wild River, Alaska may have traded traffic-covered streets for snow-covered mountains, but things aren’t always as quiet as they seem. Making a life in a picturesque northern community means counting on your friends, neighbors and newcomers for company, friendship, help and sometimes, love.

Get to know picturesque Wild River in An Alaskan Christmas by Jennifer Snow.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Jennifer Snow

The Notorious Greek Billionaires

This brand new Harlequin Presents series brings us into one of Greece’s richest and most formidable families where a business deal includes a marriage to one of the family’s bachelor sons—but where we soon learn that a contract can’t dictate the terms of love, passion or betrayal.

Claiming My Hidden Son by Maya Blake is book one in The Notorious Greek Billionaires series.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Maya Blake

NOLA Knights

The Russian mafia has put down roots in New Orleans, a city whose underground is already teeming with crimes and passions that play out in many shades of grey. But the Knights are there to conduct business—and pleasure. 

Living in a town ruled by a mobster with heart? It’s complicated.

Meet the NOLA Knights in His to Defend by Rhenna Morgan.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Rhenna Morgan

American Heavy Metal

In one of America’s oldest and most important classic-car shops, the founder has just died, leaving his struggling legacy in the hands of his daughter—who isn’t sure she ever wanted to return to the life she left behind. Cars are not the only things to get overhauled day after day at this classic body shop.

Check out the goods at American Heavy Metal with Hard Chrome by Vanessa North.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Vanessa North

Secrets of a Victorian Household

They may seem grand and imposing, but the rich and aristocratic households in Victorian-era England harbor secret histories and mysteries that could ruin prospects and pursuits.

Discover what the servants and society ladies are whispering about in Miss Lottie’s Christmas Protector by Sophia James.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Sophia James

Are you ready to try out a new series? Let us know which one you’ll be picking up!

item.title: How to Find Your Perfect Romance Hero
item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.category: Home on the Ranch: Colorado Rancher
item.description: by Karen Green No matter what genre of romance book you prefer, there’s a hero waiting to knock your socks off in its pages. From otherworldly beings to the most down-to-earth guys you’ve ever read, these heroes may seem very different, but they have all the really important things in common, like courage, chivalry, enough […]
item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

No matter what genre of romance book you prefer, there’s a hero waiting to knock your socks off in its pages.

From otherworldly beings to the most down-to-earth guys you’ve ever read, these heroes may seem very different, but they have all the really important things in common, like courage, chivalry, enough vulnerability to make them relatable and, oh yeah–they are sexy as anything.

Looking For A Good Guy? Read A Man You Can Trust by Jo McNally

Nick West is the epitome of the good guy hero for fans of contemporary fiction.

He’s an ex-cop, which means he may have shed the uniform but he’ll never lose his sense of duty to help those in trouble or his need to stand up for what’s right.

If Nick West is the kind of hero for you, pick up A Man You Can Trust, part of the Gallant Lake Stories series by Jo McNally and get to know this traditional alpha today.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

Need A Little Danger? Read Tangled Threat by Heather Graham

Fans of romantic intrigue may also be interested in a hero that’s a little mysterious; someone who you may have to get know slowly, by peeling back many layers.

A hero like Brock McGovern, star of Heather Graham’s new suspenseful read, Tangled Threat.

Brock is an FBI agent, so he’s cautious with words and actions by training as well as by nature, and when he’s called to his hometown to help solve an old mystery, he’ll also try to heal an old romantic wound.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

Love Paranormal Heroes? Read Frost and Flame by Gena Showalter

Bane may be an immortal warrior but he’s not immune to pain and heartbreak, which he has been carrying, along with a plan for revenge, ever since his wife was murdered.

If this kind of sexy, paranormal hero is for you, check out Frost and Flame, the second book in the Gods of War series by Gena Showalter.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

Want An Uplifting Companion? Read Their Christmas Prayer by Myra Johnson

If faith and family is important in your romance reads, then you can’t find a more ideal hero than Shaun O’Grady in Myra Johnson’s Their Christmas Prayer.

Shaun is a pastor but his faith has been shaken so he’s staying at his family’s ranch while he decides whether the time is right to leave on another international mission.

But soon he meets Brooke, a confident, gorgeous woman who makes him start to think that he might not want to leave Juniper Bluff after all—and she definitely doesn’t want to be there without him.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

Need A Western Hero? Read Home on the Ranch: Colorado Rancher by Patricia Potter

Lastly, if you like authentic western romances and cowboys in all of their dusty, dirty, capable glory, you will love Reese Howard, the hero with heart featured in Patricia Potter’s Home on the Ranch: Colorado Rancher from the Home to Covenant Falls series.

Reese is dedicated to three things: the land he works on, the wild mustangs on the land and the children of veterans who come to the ranch for equine therapy.

Laura is a former fighter pilot who takes her teen to the ranch, and soon Reese and Laura discover an attraction to each other that neither one wants to tame.  

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

So did we cover the kind of hero you like to read about? Because really, when it comes to romantic heroes, there are no wrong answers.

item.title: Fight the Cold Weather with 6 Steamy Passionate Reads
item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.description: by Karen Green It may be fall but as long as we have these scorching reads on hand, there will be no need to turn the furnace on for a while yet. Featuring our favorite returning series and some brand new directions, all of these books push the limit when it comes to sexy storylines, […]
item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

It may be fall but as long as we have these scorching reads on hand, there will be no need to turn the furnace on for a while yet.

Featuring our favorite returning series and some brand new directions, all of these books push the limit when it comes to sexy storylines, keeping the heat at a maximum from the very first page.

So bring on fall weather and whatever chilly surprises are in store for us; we’ve got the goods to keep things hot all season long.

Hard Chrome by Vanessa North

In a brand new series sure to rev up the temps, a classic car shop sets the scene for a different kind of bodywork. Hard Chrome is the debut story in the American Heavy Metal series by Vanessa North.

This enemies-to-lovers story brings the heat as the tension between a mechanic and the faltering business’s heir reaches a fever pitch—and resolves itself in the sexiest way possible.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Vanessa North

Ready for the Rancher by Zuri Day

Why not skip a weekend of gazing at the changing colors and head somewhere that’s still sizzling well into the fall season?

There’s a reason they say that what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas and the exploits of a wealthy rancher and his enemy’s sister is definitely one of the secrets best left in Sin City. Check out Ready for the Rancher, part of the Sin City Secrets series by Zuri Day.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Zuri Day

His to Defend by Rhenna Morgan

Rhenna Morgan launches a brand new spinoff to the popular Men of Haven series with NOLA Knights and His to Defend—and these storylines are just as sexy and just as exciting as we’ve come to expect.

In this inaugural installment, a Russian mafia boss with an eye out for his community, agrees to help a struggling waitress provide for her son—a deal that she isn’t sure she’s made with an angel or a devil.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Rhenna Morgan

Goalie Interference by Avon Gale and Piper Vaughn

Hockey definitely becomes a contact sport in this LGBTQ romance Goalie Interference by Avon Gale and Piper Vaughn, part of the Hat Trick series and featuring a storyline hot enough to melt center ice.

When a star goalie and a rookie player must compete for a place in the starting lineup, things quickly get physical…in the game and in the bedroom.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Avon Gale

More from Piper Vaughn

Immortal Born by Lynsay Sands

Autumn is the season for all things spooky and otherworldly so it’s the perfect time to heat things up with paranormal romance.

In the latest Argeneau Novel, Immortal Born by Lynsay Sands, caring for an orphaned vampire is a tricky enough task, but when his human guardian is hunted by a group determined to take the child back, she must rely on an immortal defender—and his protection is not the only thing she desires from him.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Lynsay Sands

The Risk by Caitlyn Crews

If the leaves haven’t fallen from the trees yet, The Risk by Caitlin Crews from the Billionaires Club series is hot enough to ignite them on their branches.

When an arrogant tycoon risks it all on a night with a sexy dancer, he has no idea that the fantasy they create will be something he continues to crave in real life, or that the striking ballerina may just be looking for more than a one-night dance partner.  

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Caitlin Crews

Feeling warmer yet? Let us know which of these stories will heat up your fall!

item.title: Enjoy Thrilling Stories with New Romantic Suspense Reads
item.dc:creator: Elissa
item.description: by Karen Green There’s no doubt that autumn is a romantic season, with the beauty of the natural world bringing us joy but also nudging us inside, where we start to nest for the winter and incorporate all things cozy back into our life. It’s the season to cuddle up and keep warm, as the […]
item.content:encoded:
by Karen Green

There’s no doubt that autumn is a romantic season, with the beauty of the natural world bringing us joy but also nudging us inside, where we start to nest for the winter and incorporate all things cozy back into our life. It’s the season to cuddle up and keep warm, as the shadows grow longer…

Shadows that also signify fall’s other grand characteristic: the undeniably spooky pall that casts its net over the season. Autumn is transitional, bringing to mind the transition between light and dark, this world and perhaps another. And of course we celebrate both of these aspects of our favorite season with festivals and fairs, pumpkin patches and Halloween.

We lucky readers have the perfect way to welcome the transitional season, with books that bring together the very best of fall. Take a look at these stories that bridge all of the romance of the season with the more mysterious aspects that seem to occur in the shadows.

Risk Everything (The Risk Series: A Bree and Tanner Thriller) by Janie Crouch

Autumn can feel very mysterious, with questions that seem to have no answers and the natural world keeping us on our toes with changes and moods it can be hard to predict.

Match that unpredictable mood with this story about a mysterious fire, an unknown threat and a couple trying to unravel a dangerous plot that has more twists and turns than a corn maze in October. 

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Janie Crouch

Killer Amnesia by Sherri Shackelford

Is there anything more chilling than not remembering who you are and feeling vulnerable to every manner of unknown threat?

For one small-town deputy, keeping an amnesiac safe while she tries to rediscover who she is leads them both to a trail of secrets that a killer will do anything to keep hidden.

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Sherri Shackelford

Reunited by the Badge (To Serve and Seduce) by Deborah Fletcher Mello

Does anything send a chill up the spine faster than a threat from something that we can’t see or identify? Something that seems big, abstract and indestructible?

So there’s nothing more chilling than the prospect of a large, faceless corporation working to harm the very people they are supposed to help, as a doctor and his ex, a lawyer, have discovered. Can they uncover the reason that patients are dying before putting themselves right into the path of danger?

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Deborah Fletcher Mello

The Stalking (Krewe of Hunters) by Heather Graham

Autumn certainly likes to show off her mysteries and thrills and there is no more perfect vehicle for paranormal possibilities than Halloween, when, just for a moment, we once again believe in ghosts.

For the Krewe of Hunters, ghosts are always present, sometimes looking to harm and sometimes offering to help. In New Orleans, where ghosts inhabit every corner of the bayou, a killer emerges. Are dark spirits the perpetrators or just the inspiration?

Harlequin | Amazon | Barnes & Noble | Google Play | Kobo | Apple Books | Goodreads

More from Heather Graham

Are you ready for fall’s thrills and chills? Let us know what you’ll be reading!
